rawContent: 5 days Paxlovid seems too short. 2% rebound in clinical trials with patients starting on day 3-5 of symptoms. In practice some start on day 1, w/less inflammation & I bet more rebound after. Longer course (7-10d) might reduce this and cut down on post-Paxlovid COVID transmission.

Long tail.

rawContent: The 5 day Paxlovid course is clearly too short and leads to some cases of “rebound.” There is no a priori way to know if a second course would work. Pfizer needs to test longer primary courses 7 or 10 days) and second course for efficacy and conversion to a resistant lineage.

3

quotedTweet.rawContent: Challenges the assumption that earlier treatment is better. In a few people, if Paxlovid suppresses virus before a strong immune response occurs, remaining virus can briefly flare up after the 5 day course. Essentially early Paxlovid can create time out for virus and immunity.
